001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakBaseline;
004import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutableOutbreakState;
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
009import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person;
010import io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration;
011import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
012
013/**
014 * Default, compositional model builder that assembles the standard set of
015 * setup, baselining and initialisation behaviours from small, focused
016 * interfaces.
017 *
018 * Extending model builders should consider whether to override behaviour by
019 * subclassing or by composing alternative interfaces. For example, to change
020 * the default outbreak baselining logic a builder could either implement a
021 * different baseliner interface or could subclass {@code DefaultModelBuilder}
022 * and override the {@code baselineOutbreak} method directly. Both approaches
023 * are valid and the best choice depends on the extent of the change and the
024 * desired level of modularity. The methods can coexist and the delegation to
025 * the default interfaces ensures that the wiring is clear and that alternative
026 * implementations can be easily swapped in without modifying the builder
027 * itself.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * Rationale: the builder composes several default behaviour interfaces (for
031 * example {@link DefaultNetworkSetup}, {@link DefaultOutbreakBaseliner} and
032 * {@link DefaultPersonInitialiser}) rather than centrally implementing all
033 * logic. This compositional approach has several benefits:
034 * <ul>
035 * <li>Separation of responsibilities — each interface encapsulates a distinct
036 * concern such as network construction or person baselining.</li>
037 * <li>Reusability — alternative builders can mix different interfaces to
038 * produce different default behaviours without duplicating code.</li>
039 * <li>Testability — small interfaces are easier to mock and test in
040 * isolation.</li>
041 * <li>Extensibility — callers can subclass {@code DefaultModelBuilder} and
042 * selectively override only the hooks they need to change.</li>
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * Implementation detail: each public method in this class delegates to the
047 * corresponding default implementation on the composed interface using
048 * {@code InterfaceName.super.method(...)}. This explicit delegation makes the
049 * wiring obvious and preserves the ability for subclasses to override behaviour
050 * either by implementing a different interface or by overriding the method
051 * directly.
052 *
053 * <p>
054 * Composition specifics: the class composes the following default interfaces in
055 * the standard build pipeline: {@link DefaultNetworkSetup},
056 * {@link DefaultOutbreakBaseliner}, {@link DefaultOutbreakInitialiser},
057 * {@link DefaultPersonBaseliner} and {@link DefaultPersonInitialiser}. The
058 * {@link DefaultPersonInitialiser} in particular centralises the orchestration
059 * that creates the in‑host model for each person (by delegating to the
060 * specialised in‑host initialiser interfaces) and sets importation and basic
061 * per‑person modifiers. To customise person initialisation replace the
062 * {@code DefaultPersonInitialiser} implementation or subclass
063 * {@code DefaultModelBuilder} and override the {@code initialisePerson}
064 * delegation method.
065 *
066 * <p>
067 * Downstream users such as examples and test harnesses can use this builder as
068 * a ready‑made configuration for most simulations and replace individual
069 * components by subclassing or by providing alternative interface
070 * implementations.
071 *
072 * @author Rob Challen
073 */
074public class DefaultModelBuilder extends AbstractModelBuilder implements
075                DefaultNetworkSetup, DefaultOutbreakBaseliner, DefaultOutbreakInitialiser,
076                DefaultPersonBaseliner, DefaultPersonInitialiser {
077
078        // TODO: look at https://github.com/jhalterman/typetools
079
080        /**
081         * Create a default model builder with the standard set of composed
082         * interfaces.
083         */
084        public DefaultModelBuilder() {
085                super();
086        }
087
088        /**
089         * Delegate outbreak base-lining to the default baseliner.
090         *
091         * <p>
092         * The method forwards to the default implementation so that global outbreak
093         * baseline concerns (policy defaults, aggregated metrics) are defined in a
094         * single place. Subclasses can override to provide custom baselining
095         * behaviour or to compose alternative baseline logic.
096         */
097        @Override
098        public ImmutableOutbreakBaseline baselineOutbreak(
099                        ImmutableOutbreakBaseline.Builder builder, Outbreak outbreak,
100                        Sampler sampler
101        ) {
102                return DefaultOutbreakBaseliner.super.baselineOutbreak(
103                                builder, outbreak, sampler
104                );
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Delegate person baselining to the default person baseliner.
109         *
110         * <p>
111         * Person level baselining (demographics, household membership, persistent
112         * attributes) is provided by {@link DefaultPersonBaseliner}. This class
113         * keeps per person baseline logic modular and easily replaceable.
114         */
115        @Override
116        public ImmutablePersonBaseline baselinePerson(
117                        ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder builder, Person person, Sampler rng
118        ) {
119                return DefaultPersonBaseliner.super.baselinePerson(builder, person, rng);
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Delegate outbreak initialisation to the default outbreak initialiser.
124         *
125         * <p>
126         * Outbreak runtime values that depend on the baselined outbreak are computed
127         * by {@link DefaultOutbreakInitialiser}. Delegating keeps this class focused
128         * on composition and makes it straightforward to swap in an alternative
129         * initialisation strategy.
130         */
131        @Override
132        public ImmutableOutbreakState initialiseOutbreak(
133                        ImmutableOutbreakState.Builder builder, Outbreak outbreak,
134                        Sampler sampler
135        ) {
136                return DefaultOutbreakInitialiser.super.initialiseOutbreak(
137                                builder, outbreak, sampler
138                );
139        }
140
141        /**
142         * Delegate person initialisation to the default initialiser.
143         *
144         * <p>
145         * The initialiser converts baseline values into runtime state. By delegating
146         * to {@link DefaultPersonInitialiser} the default conversion logic (for
147         * example seeding infection timers or initial immunity) is centralised and
148         * can be updated independently of the model builder.
149         */
150        @Override
151        public ImmutablePersonState initialisePerson(
152                        ImmutablePersonState.Builder builder, Person person, Sampler rng
153        ) {
154                return DefaultPersonInitialiser.super.initialisePerson(
155                                builder, person, rng
156                );
157        }
158
159        /**
160         * Delegate outbreak setup to the default network setup implementation.
161         *
162         * <p>
163         * This method intentionally delegates to
164         * {@link DefaultNetworkSetup#setupOutbreak(ModifiableOutbreak, SetupConfiguration, Sampler)}
165         * so that network construction is maintained in a focused interface. To
166         * change network construction replace the composed interface or override
167         * this method in a subclass.
168         */
169        @Override
170        public ModifiableOutbreak setupOutbreak(
171                        ModifiableOutbreak outbreak, SetupConfiguration config, Sampler sampler
172        ) {
173                return DefaultNetworkSetup.super.setupOutbreak(outbreak, config, sampler);
174        }
175
176}
